page.title: 10Problems with the Church
page.content: During the last summer of 1985 dry rot was discovered in the Lady Chapel ceiling and also behind the organ and work is in hand to execute the necessary cure. Money is always a problem but parishioners support church fundraising extremely well, the main fundraising being the Anual Autumn Fair. The last one realised in excess of 900 pounds, which for a parish of about 300 inhabitants is quite good. The Church features in many church hisorical books as being of great interest and sees more visitors during a week than many other village churches. The tombs of the Fitzherbert family are now in the chancel. Lord Stafford is the current head of the family and they have recently undertaken the repair and cleaning of the tombs.
